parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

description: A findings domain that contains tests that measure a person's ocular health and visual status, to detect abnormalities in the components of the visual system, and to determine how well the person can see. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C147180, 2021-06-25)

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the OE measurements were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the OE CRF using the Ophthalmic Examinations (OEDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C119013

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record which [eye was/eyes were] the focus of the finding or observation.
fields.definition: An identifier used for the identification of a focus of study-specific interest on or within a subject or specimen (as described in the protocol), for which a measurement, test, or examination was performed, such as a drug application site (e.g., "Injection site 1", "Biopsy site 1", "Treated site 1"), or a more specific focus (e.g., "OD" (right eye), "Upper left quadrant of the back"). The value in this variable should have inherent semantic meaning.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is expected to be populated for ophthalmic studies. It is used as the key identifying variable to denote the focus (which eye or eyes) of the test finding or observation.
fields.label: Focus of Study-specific Interest
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: FOCID
fields.questionText: Which eye/eyes?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned measurement, test, observation or specimen was performed/collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This field is used to capture a response regarding whether a planned measurement, test, or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the --STAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".
fields.label: Ophthalmic Examination Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable OESTAT. If the CDASH variable OEPERF="N", the value of the SDTM variable OESTAT is "NOT DONE". If OEPERF= "Y", OESTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., OECAT and OESCAT, OETPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable OETESTCD would be populated with OEALL and an appropriate test name (OETEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.3 Section 4.5.1.2.
fields.name: OEPERF
fields.questionText: Was an ophthalmic examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the ophthalmic examination measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT); in such cases, a separate measurement date field is not required.
fields.label: Ophthalmic Examination Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable OEDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: OEDAT
fields.questionText: What was the date of the ophthalmic examination measurement?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.completionInstructions: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of the measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.
fields.label: Ophthalmic Examination Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: OETIM
fields.questionText: What was the time the ophthalmic examination measurement?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C117742

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test, or Exam

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Name of Ophthalmic Test or Exam

self.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

fields.definition: Descriptive name for the test being performed.
fields.implementationNotes: The test name will usually be pre-printed on the CRF, and not solicited as a question. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included as the column heading. OETEST is most useful as the PROMPT on the field in which the RESULT for that test is collected. See CDASHIG metadata tables for domain-specific TEST codelist names (e.g. EGTEST, FATEST).
fields.label: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column. The SDTM variable OETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in OETEST. The SDTMIG variables OETESTCD and OETEST are required in SDTM.
fields.name: OETEST
fields.questionText: What was the name of the ophthalmic [measurement/test/examination]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: A further description of OETESTCD and OETEST.
fields.implementationNotes: It is recommended that the test detail name be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then "Test" or "Test Name" can be included in the column heading.
fields.label: Measurement, Test or Examination Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OETSTDTL
fields.questionText: What was the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Category for Ophthalmic Test or Exam

fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata tables and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column heading. Note: CDISC Controlled terminology (IECAT) is used for the IE domain.
fields.label: Category
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OECAT
fields.questionText: What was the [type/category] of the ophthalmic examination?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Subcategory for Ophthalmic Test or Exam

fields.definition: A sub-division of the OECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. OESCAT can only be used if there is a OECAT. Examples are provided in the CDASHIG metadata table and in the SDTMIG. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included in the column heading. OESCAT can only be used if there is a OECAT.
fields.label: Subcategory
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OESCAT
fields.questionText: What was the [subtype/subcategory] of the ophthalmic examination?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Result of Finding in Original Unit

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: Result of Finding in Original Unit

fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: Result of Finding in Original Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the ophthalmic examination test?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
fields.label: Original Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.definition: The result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: The CDASH field OERES is used when the collected results are not mapped directly to the SDTM variable OEORRES and must be mapped, for example: OERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included and "Specify Other" is collected. OERES is collected using Normal, Abnormal and a description of the abnormality is collected.
fields.label: Collected Result or Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. The mapping instructions depend on the implementation, for example: Where OERES Normal, Abnormal or other similar type classifications (e.g., Absent/Present) with a description of the abnormal result using the CDASH field OEDESC. For SDTM submission datasets, If the CDASH field OERES = "NORMAL", populate the SDTM variables OEORRES and OESTRESC with the value of the CDASH field OERES. If the CDASH field OERES is "ABNORMAL", populate the SDTM variable OEORRES with the CDASH field OEDESC. If the reported findings in OEDESC are coded using a dictionary, then the SDTM variable OESTRESC is populated with the dictionary preferred term and OEMODIFY is populated with the modified text used for coding. If the reported findings in OEDESC are not coded, then the SDTM variable OESTRESC is populated with the CDASH OEDESC field. The SDTM variable OENRIND may be populated with "NORMAL" or "ABNORMAL" if appropriate. Where OERES is used to collect standardized values (e.g., a codelist) on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field OERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other". When using this field, the "OTHER" value recorded in the CDASH field OERES field is mapped to the SDTM variable OESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field OERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable OEORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: OERES
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [result/amount] (of the [measurement/test/examination])?; [Is/Was] the result [normal/abnormal/absent/present/ sponsored defined response]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.definition: A free-text result which provides further information about the original received or collected result.
fields.implementationNotes: In a case where OERES is used to collect standardized values on the CRF and the value of "OTHER" is included, the CDASH field OERESOTH can be used to collect free-text values for "Specify Other".
fields.label: Result Other
fields.mappingInstructions: When using this CDASH field, the "OTHER" value collected in the CDASH field OERES is mapped to the SDTM variable OESTRESC and the value in the CDASH field OERESOTH is mapped to the SDTM variable OEORRES. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: OERESOTH
fields.questionText: If other is selected, [explain/specify/provide more detail].

implements.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

self.title: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit

fields.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in OEORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: OEORNRLO should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable OESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: Normal Range Lower Limit- Original Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEORNRLO
fields.questionText: What was the lower limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

self.title: Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit

fields.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in OEORRES.
fields.implementationNotes: OEORNRHI should be populated only for continuous findings. The SDTM variable OESTNRC should be populated only for noncontinuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: Normal Range Upper Limit- Original Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEORNRHI
fields.questionText: What was the upper limit of the reference range (for the [measurement/test/examination])?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: Normal references ranges that are expressed as characters ("Negative to Trace") or ordinal (-1 to 1).
fields.implementationNotes: Should be populated for normal ranges that are reported as character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be derived from a site- or lab-specific set of normal ranges stored in a look-up table.
fields.label: Collected Character/Ordinal Normal Range
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OECSTNRC
fields.questionText: What was the normal reference range (for this [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78736

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
fields.implementationNotes: Reference ranges may be defined by OEORNRLO, OEORNRHI, OESTNRC, or other objective criteria. Reference Range Indicator (e.g., Y, N; HIGH, LOW; NORMAL, ABNORMAL) may be included if not derived or determined programmatically after data collection. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
fields.label: Normal/Reference Range Indicator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OENRIND
fields.questionText: How do the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indicator of the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Used to categorize the result of a finding or medical status per interpretation of test results (e.g., "POSITIVE", "NEGATIVE"). The variable OERESCAT is not meant to replace the use of OENRIND for cases where normal ranges are provided.
fields.label: Result Category
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OERESCAT
fields.questionText: What is the the category for the reported values?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When OEREASND is used, OESTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEREASND
fields.questionText: What was the reason that the [ophthalmic examination finding] was not [collected/answered/done/assessed/evaluated]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of the measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: For the OE domain, this value is pre-populated as "EYE". It does not need to be pre-printed on the CRF or collected.
fields.label: Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OELOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the ophthalmic examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the laterality of the location of the OETEST within a given eye. It should never be used to designate "Right Eye" versus "Left Eye". OEFOCID is used to denote which eye is the focus of the observation. This may be pre-printed or collected.
fields.label: Laterality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OELAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the directionality of the location of the OETEST (e.g., ANTERIOR, LOWER, PROXIMAL). This may be pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
fields.label: Directionality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99075

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
fields.implementationNotes: Further detailing the portion or totality of the location of the OETEST. This may be pre-printed or collected.
fields.label: Portion or Totality
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEPORTOT
fields.questionText: What was the portion or totality (of the anatomical location of the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The method of the test or examination.
fields.label: Method of Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method (used for the [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.
fields.label: Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEEVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An identifier used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role recorded in OEEVAL.
fields.label: Evaluator Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEEVALID
fields.questionText: What is the identifier of the evaluator?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: An indication that the evaluation is considered, by an independent assessor, to be the accepted or final evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used where more than 1 assessor provides an evaluation of a result or response. Typically a checkbox with the value of "Y" or "NULL", which indicates the evaluation was accepted.
fields.label: Accepted Record Flag
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEACPTFL
fields.questionText: Is this record considered to be the [accepted/final] evaluation?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

fields.definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
fields.implementationNotes: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be pre-printed on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample.
fields.label: Repetition Number
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the SDTM Target column.
fields.name: OEREPNUM
fields.questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

label: Ophthalmic Examinations
name: OE
